Class GameModeHandler

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.core.GameModeHandler
public final class GameModeHandler extends Object
Handles switching between game modes, manages timed countdowns, and communicates mode changes to interested consumers.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Eashwar

  • Constructor Details

    • GameModeHandler

      public GameModeHandler(javafx.scene.control.Label timerLabel, Runnable onTimeUp, Consumer<GameModeHandler.GameMode> onModeChanged)
      Creates a handler for managing game modes and timers.
      Parameters:
      timerLabel - label used for displaying countdown when timed mode
      onTimeUp - callback invoked when the countdown reaches zero
      onModeChanged - consumer notified on mode changes

  • Method Details

    • getMode

      public GameModeHandler.GameMode getMode()

    • startNormal

      public void startNormal()
      Activates normal mode without timers and hides the countdown label.

    • startUpsideDown

      public void startUpsideDown()
      Activates bottoms-up mode and hides the countdown label.

    • startTimed

      public void startTimed()
      Activates timed mode, displays the countdown label, and starts a timer.

      Pauses the active countdown timer if present.

    • resume

      public void resume()
      Resumes the countdown timer when the label is visible.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops and clears the countdown timer if present.

    • restartForNewGame

      public void restartForNewGame()
      Restarts timing setup for a new game based on the current mode.
